data.title: The Velvet Underground
data.meta_description: The Velvet Underground Web Page - USA LPs
data.text:
Verve V-5008, 1967

Disc Jockey Record, yellow label (East Coast pressing), mono

Side 1: V5008 Side 1 MG558 Rev

Side 2: V5008 SIDE 2 MG559

Mono

Gatefold cover with banana sticker

Emerson on back cover

pressing by MGM Record Manufacturing Division, Bloomfield, New Jersey

(1.25"pressing ring, block-looking 'S' engraved in the deadwax)

Yellow/black T Verve promo label, "Disc Jockey Record / NOT FOR SALE"

Song credits: "Reed - Cale - Morrison - Tucker"

Publishing credits: "Three Prong Music | All Selections BMI"

"MGM RECORDS - A DIVISION OF METRO-GOLDWYN-MAYER, INC. - Made in U.S.A."

Verve V-5008, 1967

D.J. Sample, white label (West Coast pressing), mono

Side 1: V-5008-S-1 MG-558-REV

Side 2: V-5008-S-2 MG-559

Mono

Gatefold cover with banana sticker and "D.J. SAMPLES / PROMOTIONAL COPIES" sticker on front cover

Emerson on back cover

pressing by H.V. Waddell, Burbank, California

(deep groove 2.75" pressing ring)

White/black T Verve promo label, "NOT FOR SALE"

Black Angel's Death Song timing is misprinted as "3:01" (instead of 3:10)

Song credits: "L. Reed - J. Cale - S. Morrison - M. Tucker"

"All Selections Three Prong Music, Inc. BMI"

"MGM RECORDS - A DIVISION OF METRO-GOLDWYN-MAYER, INC. - Made in U.S.A."

Verve V-5008, 1967

original stock copy with Emerson, East Coast pressing, mono

Side 2: V5008 SIDE 2 MG559

Publishing credits: "Three Prong Music | All Selections BMI"

"MGM RECORDS - A DIVISION OF METRO-GOLDWYN-MAYER, INC. - Made in U.S.A."

Notes: 1.25" pressing ring, block-looking 'S' engraved in the deadwax and the label fonts indicate a pressing by MGM Record Manufacturing Division, Bloomfield, New Jersey.

According to an advertisement in Billboard, October 15, 1966 "MGM's Celibrity Series packages, aim at bringing stars to the attention of DJ's and stations".

Verve V6-5008, circa 1971

stereo reissue without Emerson, East Coast 'late' pressing (Keel Mfg. Corp.)

Side 1: V6-5008 SIDE-1 MGS-558 REV

Side 2: V6-5008 SIDE-2 MGS-559-RE-1

Stereo

Gatefold cover with banana sticker

Airbrushed Emerson

pressing by Keel Mfg. Corp., Hauppauge, New York

(the label has a 2.75" pressing ring, with a faint small ring of 0.4375" next to the spindle hole, and a stamped 'K' shows up in the deadwax. After MGM shuttered its Bloomfield, NJ plant in 1971, they arranged for Pickwick-owned Keel Mfg. Corp., Hauppauge, New York to press their LP's and 45's on the East Coast)

Blue/silver T Verve label

Song credits: "Reed - Cale - Morrison - Tucker"

Publishing credits: "Three Prong Music | All Selections BMI"

"MGM RECORDS - A DIVISION OF METRO-GOLDWYN-MAYER, INC. - Made in U.S.A."

Verve V6-5008, circa 1971?

stereo reissue without Emerson, West Coast 'late' pressing

Side 1: V6-5008 SIDE-1 MGS-558-REV

Side 2: V6-5008 SIDE-2 MGS-559

Stereo

Gatefold cover with banana sticker

Airbrushed Emerson

later pressing by H.V. Waddell, Burbank, California

(2 pressing rings: one 2.875" diameter pressing ring and an outer ring at about 3.625")

Blue/silver T Verve label

There She Goes Again 2:03

Black Angel's Death Song 3:01

Song credits: "L. Reed - J. Cale - S. Morrison - M. Tucker"

Publishing credits: "All Selections Three Prong Music, Inc. BMI"

"MGM RECORDS - A DIVISION OF METRO-GOLDWYN-MAYER, INC. - Made in U.S.A."

Pusblishings credits move from "Three Prong Music" to "Oakfied Avenue Music".

Oakfied Avenue Music, Ltd. is an entity registered at New York county with company number 243593, by Dennis Katz located at the address 110 E. 59Th St New York, New York, 10022. Company is incorporated on October 3, 1972 (Source: NYS Departement of State | Division of Corporations).

Airbrushed Emerson

pressing by Keel Mfg. Corp., Hauppauge, New York

(2.75" pressing ring with a faint small ring of 0.4375" next to the spindle hole)

Blue/silver T Verve label

Song credits: "Reed - Cale - Morrison - Tucker"

Publishing credits: all songs "Oakfield Avenue Music", except I'm Waiting For The Man "Three Prong Music", "All Selections BMI"

"MGM RECORDS - A DIVISION OF METRO-GOLDWYN-MAYER, INC. - Made in U.S.A."

Verve V6-5008, post-1972

close-cut banana sticker, "Oakfield" Publishing, "Hollywood" address

Side 1: V6-5008 SIDE-1 MGS-558 REV

Side 2: V6-5008 SIDE-2 MGS-559-RE-1

Stereo

Glossy gatefold cover with glossy close-cut banana sticker - the excess margin is trimmed away

Airbrushed Emerson

pressing by by Shelley Products, Ltd., Huntington Station, New York

(label diameter is 3.875" (a bit smaller than earlier editions) and the S mark engraved in the deadwax indicates this record was pressed by Shelley Products, Ltd., Huntington Station, NY, which began pressing for MGM upon PolyGram's acquisition of the label in 1972)

Blue/silver T Verve label

Song credits: "L. Reed - J. Cale - S. Morrison - M. Tucker"

Publishing credits: all songs "Oakfield Ave. Music Co. BMI", except I'm Waiting For The Man "Three Prong Music, Inc. BMI"

"MANUFACTURED BY MGM RECORDS, INC., 7165 SUNSET BOULEVARD, HOLLYWOOD, CALIF. 90046"

Side 2: V6-5008 SIDE-2 MGS-559-RE-1

Same pressing as the "close-cut banana sticker" edition.

pressing by by Shelley Products, Ltd., Huntington Station, New York

(label diameter is 3.875" (a bit smaller than earlier editions) and the S mark engraved in the deadwax indicates this record was pressed by Shelley Products, Ltd., Huntington Station, NY, which began pressing for MGM upon PolyGram's acquisition of the label in 1972)

Publishing credits: all songs "Oakfield Avenue Music Company BMI", except I'm Waiting For The Man "Three Prong Music, Inc. BMI"

"MANUFACTURED BY MGM RECORDS, INC., 7165 SUNSET BOULEVARD, HOLLYWOOD, CALIF. 90046"

Verve MGM V6-5008, 1973

Side 1: V65008 MGS 558 1-11-1 PRC

Side 2: V65008 MGS 559 1-1-11 PRC

Stereo

Gatefold cover with printed banana. "Manufacted by MGM Record Division METRO-GOLDWYN-MAYER inc, 1350 Avenue of the Americas, New York, New York 10019" inside the gatefold.

Black label. Some with white label with Verve and MGM lion logos in circles.

Verve Polydor V6-5008, 1975

Stereo

Gatefold cover with printed banana

Black label, distributed by Polydor

Some copies mispressed with mono side 2!

Verve Polygram V6-5008, 197?

No gatefold cover with printed banana and "THE VELVET UNDERGROUND & NICO" printed in upper lef-hand corner

Back cover with airbrushed Emerson and credits

Blue/silver T Verve label

Some copies mispressed with both sides mono!

Verve Polydor Polygram V6-5008, 1978

Side 1: V-5008 MG-558-1-1-111-P PRC

Side 2: V5008 MG-559-1-1-11-

Stereo

No gatefold cover with printed banana and "THE VELVET UNDERGROUND & NICO" printed in upper lef-hand corner

Back cover with airbrushed Emerson, credits, and New York label address

Black/silver T Verve label

Some copies mispressed with both sides mono!

Verve Polygram V6-5008, 1978

PolyGram Records reissue, PRC pressing

Side 1: V6-5008 MGS-558-I-II-II PRC

Side 2: V6-5008 MGS-559-I-I-I PRC

"THE VELVET UNDERGROUND & NICO" printed on front cover

Back cover without barcode, with Warhol/Wilson production credits, no Emerson

Black/silver T Verve label

Publishing credits: all songs "Oakfield Avenue Music Company BMI", except I'm Waiting For The Man "Three Prong Music, Inc. BMI"

"MANUFACTURED AND MARKETED BY POLYDOR INCORPORATED 810 SEVENTH AVENUE NY NY 10019"

Pressed by PRC

Verve Polygram V6-5008, 1978

PolyGram Records reissue, Presswell pressing

Side 1: V5008 MG-558-1-1-1 8 PR

Side 2: V5008 MG-559-1-1-1 8 PR

No gatefold. "THE VELVET UNDERGROUND & NICO" printed on front cover

Back cover without barcode, with Warhol/Wilson production credits, no Emerson

Black/silver T Verve label

Publishing credits: all songs "Oakfield Avenue Music Company BMI", except I'm Waiting For The Man "Three Prong Music, Inc. BMI"

"MANUFACTURED AND MARKETED BY POLYDOR INCORPORATED 810 SEVENTH AVENUE NY NY 10019"

Pressed by Presswell

Verve Polygram Classics V6-5008, 1982

Stereo

No gatefold cover with printed banana and "THE VELVET UNDERGROUND & NICO" printed in upper lef-hand corner

Same as above with address at 55th St.

Black/silver T Verve label, "MANUFACTURED AND MARKETED BY POLYGRAM CLASSICS, INC., 137 W. 55TH ST., N.Y., N.Y. 10019" printed

Also some copies with "mono/stereo" mastering mysteries.

Verve Polygram 422 823 290-1 Y-1, 1985

'Special Low Price' PolyGram Records reissue | black Verve label

Side 1: V6-5008 MG5-558-1-2-4-A PRC H9 09

Side 2: V5008 MG-559-1-1-11 H9 09 P.R.

Barcode: 0 422-823290-1

Digitally remastered

No gatefold. "THE VELVET UNDERGROUND & NICO" printed on front cover. "Special Low Price" printed in lower left corner

Back cover with barcode, new remastering credit, distributed by Polygram, no Warhol/Wilson production credits, no Emerson

Inner sleeve with Kurt Loder liner notes

Black/silver T Verve label without label address

Publishing credits: all songs "Oakfield Avenue Music Company BMI", except I'm Waiting For The Man "Three Prong Music, Inc. BMI"

Pressed by PRC Recording Company, Richmond, Indiana

Verve Polygram 422-823 290-1 Y-1, 1985?

'Special Low Price' PolyGram Records reissue | orange Polydor label

Digitally remastered

No gatefold. "THE VELVET UNDERGROUND & NICO" printed on front cover. "Special Low Price" printed in lower left corner

Barcode on top right corner, new remastering credit, distibuted by Polygram, no Warhol/Wilson production credits

Inner sleeve with Kurt Loder liner notes

Orange Polydor label, "MANUFACTURED & MARKETED BY POLYGRAM RECORD, INC. 810 SEVENTH AVENUE NEW YORK, NY 10019"

Verve V6-5008, 1998

Side 1: S 35947

Side 2: S 35948

Verve replica

Gatefold with printed banana

Back cover without Emerson

Blue/silver T Verve label with Hollywood label address - the blue is less dark than on original Verve pressings

Reissued in 2000 as limited edition of 500 copies on yellow vinyl - see below

Verve V6-5008, March 2000

Side 1: 3972 V65008 1(A) S 35947 RE

Side 2: 3972 V6 5008 1(B) S 35948 RE

Verve replica on yellow vinyl, limited edition of 500 copies.

Gatefold with printed banana

Back cover without Emerson

Blue/silver T Verve label with Hollywood label address - the blue is less dark than on original Verve pressings

Verve V-5008, 2004

Verve Universal 823 290-1, 2008

Back To Black Edition

Side 1: VU 8232901 - A1 [signature]

Side 2: 823-2901-1B Vu & NICO B [signature] -1 [signature]

2008 US limited edition 11-track LP pressed on 180gram VIRGIN VINYL, issued as part of the 'Back To Black 60th Anniversary' series celebrating the 60th anniversary of the vinyl record. Includes a voucher to download an MP3 version of the album, superbly presented in gatefold sleeve with screenprinted vinyl peelable banana sticker, plus the original 'torso' back cover, with repro 'Verve' blue & silver labels).

Back cover reads 823 290-1 STEREO catalog number on top left, "© 1967 Universal Records, a Division of UMG Recordings, Inc, 1755 Broadway, NY 10019 - USA. Distributed by Universal Music Distribution. All rights reserved. 823 290-1" at bottom, and has barcode on top right.

Also exists with black sticker without MP3 voucher.

Verve Universal 823 290-1, December 2, 2014

Side 1: VU 823290 1 A1 M

Side 2: VU & NICO B MJ - R 833-290-1B

Newbury Comics exclusive yellow and black split vinyl. Limited Edition of 1000.

Same cover as the 'Back To Black' 2008 Universal reissue with peelable banana, Emerson and additional 'Newbury Comics' sticker.

Verve V6/5008, 2017

no matrix numbers

Gatefold cover with printed banana (repro of the original banana sticker).

Back cover with Emerson, without catalog number & without barcode.

Clear yellow vinyl.

Yellow/bue label. All Tomorrow's Parties is misprinted "All Tomorriw's Parties" on side 1 label.

No evidence that it was really manufactured in the US, maybe a counterfeit.

Verve Universal 823 290-1 (B0026609-01), June 30, 2017

50th Anniversary Edition

Side 1: VU 8232901 - A1 M

Side 2: VU & NICO B My - 1 n 823-290-1B

50th Anniversary Limited Deluxe Packaging.

Gatefold cover with banana sticker (large-cut version, the European edition has the classic banana sticker).

Emerson lawsuit-threat sticker with barcode ("50th Anniversary Edition | THE VELVET UNDERGROUND & NICO | PRODUCED BY ANDY WARHOL | Verve") on back cover shrinkwrap (same as European edition).

Back cover with "823 290-1 | STEREO" printed on top left, barcode on top right. "© 1967 Universal records, a Division of UMG Recordings Inc., 1755 Broadway, New York, NY 10019—USA. Distibuted by Universal Music Distribution. All rights reserved. 823 290-1".

"823 290-1 | The Velvet Underground & Nico | Produced By Andy Warhol | Verve" printed on spine.

12-page insert (with cover photo by Billy Name, liner notes by John Cale and Richie Unterberger, lyrics & credits) has been added for the 50th anniversary.

Black vinyl. Limited edition of 1000 copies on pink vinyl.

"Three Pong Music BMI"

Blue/silver T Verve label. "Three Prong Music All Selections BMI". "MGM RECORDS - A DIVISION OF METRO-GOLDWYN-MAYER, INC. - Made in U.S.A.". The label looks a bit different from above edition - the text on both sides of the T goes down lower. "Side 1" seems printed in a thicker size. The band name is certainly in a thicker/bigger size. Most of the text seems slightly bigger. It looks more like the text on this label of the mono white label promo.
